title: I build full-stack tools for experiential teams.
subtitle: I’m Harrison, a self-taught developer. I turn loose ideas into working systems.
content:
Give me the messy version. I’ll find the plan, trim what isn’t needed, and make it solid.

Calm process, clear decisions, usable results.
metaDescription: Harrison Callahan builds full-stack tools for experiential teams. Self-taught developer turning loose ideas into working systems.

about.title: What I do
about.introduction: I like projects with rough edges and moving parts. I listen first, map the constraints, then build the simplest path that holds up.
about.description: My default is practical: start small, make sure it works, add only what earns a place. Clear structure, steady pace, easy to maintain.
about.experience: 12+ years on the web. Two experiential management teams. Self-taught. Comfortable when the brief is a little vague.
about.additional: What matters: plain language, honest timelines, maintainable systems, calm collaboration.

featuredProjects.title: Selected projects
featuredProjects.subtitle: A few builds. Short notes on what was unclear, what I tried, and how it turned out.

recentExperience.title: Recent experience
recentExperience.subtitle: A quick look at places I’ve contributed. For context, see the full history.

contactCTA.text: Have a rough idea or an active project? Happy to talk it through.
